thread.title: Chelsea keeper Asmir Begovic frustrated with backup role to Thibaut Courtois but remains committed until the summer
thread.title_full: Chelsea keeper Asmir Begovic frustrated with backup role to Thibaut Courtois but remains committed until the summer

author: gstonehouse
title: Chelsea keeper Asmir Begovic frustrated with backup role to Thibaut Courtois but remains committed until the summer
text:
'IT BUGS ME' Chelsea keeper Asmir Begovic frustrated with backup role to Thibaut Courtois but remains committed until the summer 
Bosnian star also reveals how Antonio Conte is more 'in your face' than Jose Mourinho BY GARY STONEHOUSE Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments GOALKEEPER Asmir Begovic admits playing understudy to Thibaut Courtois “bugs” him, but insists he remains “fully committed” to the Blues until at least the summer. 
The Bosnian reportedly wanted to leave Stamford Bridge last month having grown frustrated with his lack of game time. Reuters 7 Asmir Begovic has admitted it bugs him playing second fiddle to Thibaut Courtois 
Amid interest from Watford , Bournemouth and West Ham , Antonio Conte was willing to allow the shotstopper to exit Chelsea , but he was unable to find a replacement No2 having had a bid rejected for Celtic’s Craig Gordon . 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Begovic has yet to play a minute in the Premier League for the table toppers this campaign, but as the club’s FA Cup keeper, he is desperate to get his hands on some silverware before a potential departure at the end of the season. 
Speaking to talkSPORT , the 29-year-old said: “I think it (not playing) bugs every professional. related articles Not so hot, Rod See the moment Jese Rodriguez misses a three-yard sitter on debut for Las Palmas in Granada defeat Yaw a Star Porto in talks with Manchester City over a loan deal with an option to buy for youngster Yaw Yeboah Barca to gazump United Barca are to go head-to-head with Manchester United for Benfica duo Lindelof and Semedo AGUERO RACE IS ON Real Madrid and Barcelona both watching Sergio Aguero's situation at City closely as summer move nears Kant live without 'em Forget Costa, Hazard, Kane and Alli, Chelsea and Spurs' success is down to Kante and Wanyama 
“The thing that keeps me going is lifting silverware and being in a successful side. 
“It bugs me but in terms of moving clubs it’s not an option at the moment. 
“I know my role in the team and the leadership I can bring. Getty Images Begovic has yet to make a Premier League appearance this season for Chelsea and has been restricted to cup ties Getty Images The Bosnian international looked set to leave Chelsea last month but the Blues were unable to find a replacement for him News Group Newspapers Ltd Celtic keeper Craig Gordon had been targeted so that Chelsea could offload Asmir Begovic 
“I am fully committed to the team until the end of the season.” 
After five impressive years at Stoke City, Begovic was signed by former Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho in 2015. 
And having experienced both the Special One and the intense Conte, the ex-Portsmouth man revealed his current boss is a lot more in your face than his old gaffer. Chelsea 3-1 Arsenal : Blues place one hand on Premier League trophy with easy win against Gunners Chelsea 4-0 Brentford : Top of the League Chelsea brush The Bees aside 
He continued: "Absolutely. He's in your face a little different. 
"I don't think there's any chance of us letting up (in the title race). 
"He won't let it happen. We will continue to the end." Getty Images Chelsea boss has stuck with Courtois in favour of Begovic between the sticks this season Getty Images Begovic was signed by Jose Mourinho for Chelsea in 2015 from Stoke City Getty Images Begovic insists that Conte is more 'in your face' than previous Blues manager Mourinho 
He added: "That's the way he is, that's his DNA. He's emotional, he takes things to heart. 
"For us it's something we are used to now." 
Chelsea are currently nine points ahead of second-placed Tottenham in the Premier League and are preparing to face Wolves next week in the FA Cup Fifth Round. Animated Antonio Conte rips trousers whilst celebrating after shoving coach
